title: Access mlflow functions outside the azureml mlflow server
body:
I am able to create an azureml mlflow client outside azure, like this.

mlflow_client = mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient(tracking_uri='https://westeurope.api.azureml.ms/mlflow/v1.0/subscriptions/.............')
mlflow_client.list_experiments()

But to access any functions, like for example list_experiments, I am getting the following error:
mlflow.exceptions.RestException: INTERNAL_ERROR: Response: {'error': {'code': 'UserError', 'severity': None, 'message': 'Bearer token not provided.', 'messageFormat': None, 'messageParameters': None, 'referenceCode': None, 'detailsUri': None, 'target': None, 'details': [], 'innerError': {'code': 'AuthorizationError', 'innerError': None}, 'debugInfo': None, 'additionalInfo': None}, 'correlation': {'operation': '46dcf7ce223c1f7f5ff5e292da12a105', 'request': '11c9d96be44eaea9'}, 'environment': 'westeurope', 'location': 'westeurope', 'time': '2022-05-11T13:18:49.5358943+00:00', 'componentName': 'mlflow'}

Is there any environment variable which I can use to pass the azure bearer token.

For example. in databricks I can pass the 'DATABRICKS_HOST' and the 'DATABRICKS_TOKEN' to the environment variable and it is able to list the experiments. Is there any similar way for azureml?
